identificationModule.briefTitle: An Eight-week Randomized,Double-blind Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Fixed-dose Combinations of T80+A5 Versus A5 Monotherapy in Patients With Hypertension Who Fail to Respond Adequately to Treatment With A5 Monotherapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: 8 Week Randomised Double-blind Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Telmisartan 80mg+ Amlodipine 5 mg vs. Amlodipine 5mg Monotherapy in Patients With Hypertension Who Fail to Respond Adequately to Treatment With Amlodipine 5mg Monotherapy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The primary objectives of this trial is to demonstrate that the fixed-dose combination of telmisartan 80mg plus amlodipine 5mg (T80/A5) is superior to amlodipine 5mg (A5) in reducing seated trough diastolic blood pressure (DBP) at 8 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Seated trough DBP after 8 weeks or last observation carried forward (LOCF). Analysis will be adjusted for treatment, country, and baseline measurement of endpoint.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment in Chinese Patients
primaryOutcomes.description: Seated trough DBP after 8 weeks or LOCF in Chinese patients. Analysis will be adjusted for treatment and baseline measurement of endpoint.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in SBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Seated trough SBP after 8 weeks or LOCF. Analysis will be adjusted for treatment, country, and baseline measurement of endpoint.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: DBP and SBP Control and Response After 8 Weeks of Treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: DBP control is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. SBP control is defined as SBP \<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. DBP response is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=10mmHg. SBP response is defined as SBP\<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=15mmHg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients in Blood Pressure Categories Over Time
secondaryOutcomes.description: BP optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg, BP normal: SBP \<130 mmHg and DBP \<85 mmHg but not optimal, BP high-normal: SBP \<140 mmHg and DBP \<90 mmHg but not normal. Grade 1 hypertension: SBP \<160 mmHg and DBP \<100 mmHg but not high-normal, Grade 2 hypertension: SBP \<180 mmHg and DBP \<110 mmHg but not grade 1, Grade 3 hypertension: SBP \>=180 mmHg or DBP \>=110 mmHg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP After 4 Weeks of Treatment
Change From Baseline in SBP After 4 Weeks of Treatment
DBP and SBP Control and Response After 4 Weeks of Treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: DBP control is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. SBP control is defined as SBP \<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. DBP response is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=10mmHg. SBP response is defined as SBP\<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=15mmHg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients in Blood Pressure Categories at 4 Weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: BP optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg, BP normal: SBP \<130 mmHg and DBP \<85 mmHg but not optimal, BP high-normal: SBP \<140 mmHg and DBP \<90 mmHg but not normal. Grade 1 hypertension: SBP \<160 mmHg and DBP \<100 mmHg but not high-normal, Grade 2 hypertension: SBP \<180 mmHg and DBP \<110 mmHg but not grade 1, Grade 3 hypertension: SBP \>=180 mmHg or DBP \>=110 mmHg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Clinically Relevant Abnormalities for Physical Examination, Pulse Rate, Laboratory Parameters and ECG.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Clinically relevant abnormalities for Physical examination, pulse rate, laboratory parameters and ECG. New abnormal findings or worsening of baseline conditions were reported as Adverse Events.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From drug administration until end of treatment plus one day

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

1. diagnosis of essential hypertension
2. failure to respond adequately to six weeks treatment with amlodipine 5 mg monotherapy
3. provision of written informed consent

Exclusion criteria:

1. clinical conditions which, in the opinion of the investigator, would not allow safe completion of the protocol and safe administration of telmisartan and amlodipine for the planned duration of this trial (e.g. populations where labeling of either product recommends against its utilization)

references.citation: Zhu D, Gao P, Holtbruegge W, Huang C. A randomized, double-blind study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a single-pill combination of telmisartan 80 mg/amlodipine 5 mg versus amlodipine 5 mg in hypertensive Asian patients. J Int Med Res. 2014 Feb;42(1):52-66. doi: 10.1177/0300060513503756. Epub 2014 Jan 3.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Whilst there were 324 patients randomised and treated, there were only 314 in the Full analysis set (FAS).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in DBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Seated trough DBP after 8 weeks or last observation carried forward (LOCF). Analysis will be adjusted for treatment, country, and baseline measurement of endpoint.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Full analysis set (FAS) defined as patients randomised, treated, with a baseline endpoint measurement and at least one post-dose endpoint measurement during the double blind (DB) phase.

analyses.pValueComment: This was the first step in the closed testing procedure of multiple endpoints. The p-value was \<0.05 so this test was considered confirmatory. Proceeding to the next step was allowed, testing the same endpoint in the subgroup of Chinese patients.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in DBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment in Chinese Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: Seated trough DBP after 8 weeks or LOCF in Chinese patients. Analysis will be adjusted for treatment and baseline measurement of endpoint.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: FAS with LOCF and further restricted to the Chinese subgroup

analyses.pValueComment: This was the second step in the closed testing procedure of multiple endpoints. The p-value was again \<0.05 so this test was also considered confirmatory.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in SBP After 8 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Seated trough SBP after 8 weeks or LOCF. Analysis will be adjusted for treatment, country, and baseline measurement of endpoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: DBP and SBP Control and Response After 8 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: DBP control is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. SBP control is defined as SBP \<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. DBP response is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=10mmHg. SBP response is defined as SBP\<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=15mmHg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients in Blood Pressure Categories Over Time
outcomeMeasures.description: BP optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg, BP normal: SBP \<130 mmHg and DBP \<85 mmHg but not optimal, BP high-normal: SBP \<140 mmHg and DBP \<90 mmHg but not normal. Grade 1 hypertension: SBP \<160 mmHg and DBP \<100 mmHg but not high-normal, Grade 2 hypertension: SBP \<180 mmHg and DBP \<110 mmHg but not grade 1, Grade 3 hypertension: SBP \>=180 mmHg or DBP \>=110 mmHg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in DBP After 4 Weeks of Treatment
Change From Baseline in SBP After 4 Weeks of Treatment
DBP and SBP Control and Response After 4 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: DBP control is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. SBP control is defined as SBP \<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment. DBP response is defined as DBP \<90 mmHg or \<80 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=10mmHg. SBP response is defined as SBP\<140 mmHg or \<130 mmHg in patients with diabetes or renal impairment or a reduction from baseline \>=15mmHg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients in Blood Pressure Categories at 4 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: BP optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg, BP normal: SBP \<130 mmHg and DBP \<85 mmHg but not optimal, BP high-normal: SBP \<140 mmHg and DBP \<90 mmHg but not normal. Grade 1 hypertension: SBP \<160 mmHg and DBP \<100 mmHg but not high-normal, Grade 2 hypertension: SBP \<180 mmHg and DBP \<110 mmHg but not grade 1, Grade 3 hypertension: SBP \>=180 mmHg or DBP \>=110 mmHg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Relevant Abnormalities for Physical Examination, Pulse Rate, Laboratory Parameters and ECG.
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinically relevant abnormalities for Physical examination, pulse rate, laboratory parameters and ECG. New abnormal findings or worsening of baseline conditions were reported as Adverse Events.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Treated set included patients who were randomised and took at least one dose of the trial medication in the double-blind treatment period.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: From drug administration until end of treatment plus one day

eventGroups.title: T80/A5
eventGroups.description: Telmisartan 80 mg plus Amlodipine 5 mg once daily

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
